body:
Since I haven't had a chance to comment this because the threads were locked swiftly, porky's punishment isn't biased. I'll explain why.
First of all, aimbot is more extreme than an auto clicker. Why? Because it grants a more unfair advantage in game than an autoclicker, which is why they treat the violation more extremely. 
Second of all, it isn't "biased" because it's D00ZIE. IF D00ZIE was using killaura or aimbot he would still be perm banned. Just because you're a donor/forum user doesn't mean you are immune to punshiments.
Finally, quit spamming the forums. Emmy isn't abusing his powers, you're just flatout wrong. 
-Spicy
body_tagged:

Second of all, it isn't "biased" because it's D00ZIE. IF D00ZIE was using killaura or aimbot he would still be perm banned. Just because you're a donor/forum user doesn't mean you are immune to punshiments.
Finally, quit spamming the forums. Emmy isn't abusing his powers, you're just flatout wrong. 
-Spicy
title: @mlg_hammy

replies.body: This.
replies.body_tagged: This.

replies.body:
ok listen.. I've been on teamspeak before just listening not talking and someone (won't mention any names) told a mod that this one person was hacking.
I was in the same game, and the mod just asked for the hacker's IGN and then banned him without even joining the game. The player who told the mod about the hacker was a regular avicus player, and is pretty popular in the community.
That's why I think some mods are biased; they sometimes ban for no reason.
What if the player ingame wasn't a hacker, and got banned JUST because that player told him he was.
Explain how this is not biased...
Also, this has happened more than once.

What if the player ingame wasn't a hacker, and got banned JUST because that player told him he was.
Explain how this is not biased...
Also, this has happened more than once.

replies.body:
Oh my god... were you even listening?
The player who told the mod about the hacker was a regular avicus player, and is pretty popular in the community.
That's why I think some mods are biased; they sometimes ban for no reason.
Just because the player is a donor/regular/staff IT DOESN'T HELP. If a mod violates the rules and hacks he/she will still be permbanned.

What if the player ingame wasn't a hacker, and got banned JUST because that player told him he was.
If he's in the teamspeak chances that he was either 
-Recording.
-Known to have reliable/descriptive information of hackers, instead of just blatantly accusing them of "hack".
-It doesn't take much to tell the difference between someone who uses killaura and someone who is actually good.
-He knows what he's talking about and has a history of alerting hackers to moderators maybe?

replies.body: Also what nolan said, I was in the teamspeak at the time with a few other players WHO HAVE A HISTORY FOR GIVING DESCRIPTIVE AND RATIONAL REPORTS OF HACKING TO MODERATORS. Instead of accusing him of "hak" we came to the conclusion that he was indeed hacking. Plus we got a few mods to spectate him and they agreed he was hacking as well. Even without the teamspeak chat he was getting multiple reports from decent pvpers that he was indeed hacking, therefore the mods came to the conclusion that he should be perm banned for hacking. End of story.
